body:
Hi @MichaelLaufer @ptooley, 

I've installed WRF with spack following this order: 
spack install gcc languages=c,c++,fortran
spack load gcc
spack compiler add
spack install python@3.6.7
spack load python
spack install wrf ^openmpi

At this moment, I had WRF installed, but as I need to use WRF-Chem+KPP, I installed flex and yacc libraries:

spack install flex
spack install yacc

And I tried to compile again inside the spack-wrf folder but it doesn't work... and the executables are not built. Am I doing something wrong? How can I install and compile wrf-chem+kpp and all their dependencies. I'm working on CentOS 7. 
[compile.log](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5849871/compile.log)

I really appreciate any help you can provide. 
Verònica
title: How to install WRF-Chem + KPP with spack @CentOS 7
